abstract:
We monitored the transmissibility of 2019 novel coronavirus disease in Zhejiang accounting the transmissions from imported cases. Even though Zhejiang is one of the worst-affected provinces, an interruption of disease transmission (i.e. instantaneous reproduction numbers <1) was observed in early/mid-February after an early social-distancing response to the outbreak.
Competing Interest Statement
The authors have declared no competing interest.
affiliations: National Natural Science Foundation of China (31871340, 71974165)
author: Ka Chun Chong; Maggie Haitian Wang; Lesley Wei; Xi Xiong; Benny Chung-ying Zee; Feng Ling; Wei Cheng; Hengyan Liu; Enfu Chen; Jingxuan Wang; Kirran N Mohammad; Shi Zhao
title: Monitoring Disease Transmissibility of 2019 Novel Coronavirus Disease in Zhejiang, China

award-group.funding-source: National Natural Science Foundation of China
